arabicText: فَقُولَا لَهُۥ قَوْلًۭا لَّيِّنًۭا لَّعَلَّهُۥ يَتَذَكَّرُ أَوْ يَخْشَىٰ
englishTranslationText:
“And	speak	to	him	courteously,	that	perhaps	
he	may	ponder	or	have	some	fear.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	usse	naram	bāt	kahna	is	ummid	par	ke	
woh	dhiyān	kare	yā	kuchh	dare.

arabicText: قَالَا رَبَّنَآ إِنَّنَا نَخَافُ أَن يَفْرُطَ عَلَيْنَآ أَوْ أَن يَطْغَىٰ
englishTranslationText: They	both	submitted,	“Our	Lord	- indeed	we	fear	that	he	may	oppress	us	or	deal	mischievously.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Donoñ	 ne	 'arz	 kiya	 aey	 hamāre	 Rab!	 Beshak	 ham	 darte	 haiñ	 ke woh	 ham	 par	
ziyādti	kare	yā	sharārat	se	pesh	āaye	.

arabicText: قَالَ لَا تَخَافَآ ۖ إِنَّنِى مَعَكُمَآ أَسْمَعُ وَأَرَىٰ
englishTranslationText: He	said,	“Do	not	fear	- I	am	with	you,	All	Hearing	and	All	Seeing.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Farmāya	daro	nahiñ	meiñ	tumhāre	sāth	hooñ	sunta	aur	dekhta.

arabicText: فَأْتِيَاهُ فَقُولَآ إِنَّا رَسُولَا رَبِّكَ فَأَرْسِلْ مَعَنَا بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ وَلَا تُعَذِّبْهُمْ ۖ قَدْ جِئْنَـٰكَ بِـَٔايَةٍۢ مِّن رَّبِّكَ ۖ وَٱلسَّلَـٰمُ عَلَىٰ مَنِ ٱتَّبَعَ ٱلْهُدَىٰٓ
englishTranslationText:
“Therefore	go	to	him	and	say,	‘We	are	the	sent	ones	of	your	Lord,	therefore	let	the	Descendants	
of	Israel	go	with	us,	and	do	not	trouble	them;	we	have	indeed	brought	to	you	a	sign	from	your	
Lord;	and	peace	be	upon	him	who	follows	the	guidance.’
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	us	ke	pās	jāo	aur	us	se	kaho	ke	ham	tere	Rab ke	bheje	huye	haiñ	to	aulād-e-Y'aqoob ko	hamāre	
sāth	chhod	de	aur	unheñ	taklif	na	de	be-shak		ham	tere	pās	tere	Rab	ki	ṭaraf	se	nishāni	lāye	haiñ	
aur	salamati	usey		jo	hidāyat	ki	pairwi	kare.

arabicText: إِنَّا قَدْ أُوحِىَ إِلَيْنَآ أَنَّ ٱلْعَذَابَ عَلَىٰ مَن كَذَّبَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ
englishTranslationText: ‘It	has	indeed	been	revealed	to	us	that	the	punishment	is	upon	the	one	who	denies	and	turns	away.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak		hamari	ṭaraf	waḥi	hui	hai	ke	'azāb	us	par	hai	jo	jhutlāye	aur	muñh	phere	.

arabicText: قَالَ فَمَن رَّبُّكُمَا يَـٰمُوسَىٰ
englishTranslationText: . Said	Firaun,	“So	who	is	the	Lord	of you	both,	O	Moosa?”
romanUrduTranslationText: Bola, “To	tum	donoñ	ka	khuda	kaun	hai, aey	Mūsā?

arabicText: قَالَ رَبُّنَا ٱلَّذِىٓ أَعْطَىٰ كُلَّ شَىْءٍ خَلْقَهُۥ ثُمَّ هَدَىٰ
englishTranslationText: He	said,	“Our	Lord	is	One	Who	gave	everything	its	proper	shape,	then	showed	the	path.”
romanUrduTranslationText: . Kahā, “Hamāra	Rab	Woh	hai	jis	ne	har	cheez	ko	us	ke	lāyiq	soorat	di	phir	rāh	dikhāyi.”

arabicText: قَالَ فَمَا بَالُ ٱلْقُرُونِ ٱلْأُولَىٰ
englishTranslationText: Said	Firaun,	“What	is	the	state	of	the	former	generations?”
romanUrduTranslationText: Bola, “Agli	sangatoñ	ka	kya	hāl	hai?”

arabicText: قَالَ عِلْمُهَا عِندَ رَبِّى فِى كِتَـٰبٍۢ ۖ لَّا يَضِلُّ رَبِّى وَلَا يَنسَى
englishTranslationText:
He	said, “Their	knowledge	is	with	my	Lord,	
(recorded)	 in	 a	 Book;	 my	 Lord	 neither	
strays	nor	forgets.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kahā, “Un	ka	'ilm	mere	Rab ke	pās	ek	kitāb	
meiñ	hai; mera	Rab na	bahke	na	bhoole.”

arabicText: ٱلَّذِى جَعَلَ لَكُمُ ٱلْأَرْضَ مَهْدًۭا وَسَلَكَ لَكُمْ فِيهَا سُبُلًۭا وَأَنزَلَ مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءًۭ فَأَخْرَجْنَا بِهِۦٓ أَزْوَٰجًۭا مِّن نَّبَاتٍۢ شَتَّىٰ
englishTranslationText:
The	One	Who	has	made	the	earth	a	bed	for	
you	and	kept	operative	roads	 for	you	in	it	
and	sent	down	water	from	the	sky;	so	with	
it	 We	 produced	 different	 pairs	 of	
vegetation.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	jis	ne	tumāre	liye	zameen	ko	bichauna	
kiya	aur	tumhāre	liye	is	meiñ	chalti	rāheñ	
rakhiñ	aur	āasmān		se	pāni	utāra	to	ham	ne	
usse	ṭarah	ṭarah	ke	sabze	ke	jode	nikāle

arabicText: كُلُوا۟ وَٱرْعَوْا۟ أَنْعَـٰمَكُمْ ۗ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَـٰتٍۢ لِّأُو۟لِى ٱلنُّهَىٰ
englishTranslationText:
Eat,	 and	 graze	 your	 cattle;	 indeed	 in	 this	
are	signs	for	people	of	intellect.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	khāo	aur	apne	maweshiyoñ	ko	charāo	
be-shak	is	meiñ	nishāniyāñ	haiñ	'aql	wāloñ	
ko.

arabicText: ۞ مِنْهَا خَلَقْنَـٰكُمْ وَفِيهَا نُعِيدُكُمْ وَمِنْهَا نُخْرِجُكُمْ تَارَةً أُخْرَىٰ
englishTranslationText:
From the	earth	We	have	created	 you,	and	
to	it	We	 shall	 return	 you,	 and	 from	it	We	
shall	raise	you	again.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ham	ne	zameen	hi	se	tumheñ	banāya	aur	isi	
me	 tumheñ	 phir	 le	 jāyeñge	 aur	 isi	 se	
tumheñ	dobārah	nikāleñ ge

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ أَرَيْنَـٰهُ ءَايَـٰتِنَا كُلَّهَا فَكَذَّبَ وَأَبَىٰ
englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	We	showed	him	all	Our	signs	-
so	he	denied	them	and	did	not	accept.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 Be-shak ham	 ne	 usey	 apni	 sab	
nishāniyāñ	 dikhāyiñ	 to	 us	 ne	jhutlāya	 aur
na	māna

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ أَرَيْنَـٰهُ ءَايَـٰتِنَا كُلَّهَا فَكَذَّبَ وَأَبَىٰ
englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	We	showed	him	all	Our	signs	-
so	he	denied	them	and	did	not	accept.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 Be-shak ham	 ne	 usey	 apni	 sab	
nishāniyāñ	 dikhāyiñ	 to	 us	 ne	jhutlāya	 aur
na	māna

arabicText: قَالَ أَجِئْتَنَا لِتُخْرِجَنَا مِنْ أَرْضِنَا بِسِحْرِكَ يَـٰمُوسَىٰ
englishTranslationText:
He	said,	“Have	you	come	 to	us	in	order	 to	
expel	 us	 from	 our	 land	 by	 your	 magic,	 O	
Moosa?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bola, “Kya	 tum	hamare	pās	is	liye	āaye	ho	
ke	 hameñ	 apne	 jādu	 ke	 sabab	 hamāri	
zameen	se	nikāl	do	aey	Mūsā?”

arabicText: فَلَنَأْتِيَنَّكَ بِسِحْرٍۢ مِّثْلِهِۦ فَٱجْعَلْ بَيْنَنَا وَبَيْنَكَ مَوْعِدًۭا لَّا نُخْلِفُهُۥ نَحْنُ وَلَآ أَنتَ مَكَانًۭا سُوًۭى
englishTranslationText:
“So	 we	 will	 also	 produce	 before	 you	 a	
similar	 magic,	 therefore	 set	 up	 an	 agreed	
time	 between	 us	 and	 you,	 from	 which	
neither	 we	 nor	 you	 shall	 turn	 away,	 at	 a	
level	place.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	zaroor	ham	bhi	Tumhāre	āage		waisa	hi	
jādo	lāyeñ	ge	to	ham	meiñ	aur	apne	meiñ	ek	
w'ada	 thehra	 do	 jis	 se	 na	 ham	 badla	 leñ	
(āage	 peeche	 hoñ)	 na	 tum	 hamwār	 jagah	
ho.

arabicText: قَالَ مَوْعِدُكُمْ يَوْمُ ٱلزِّينَةِ وَأَن يُحْشَرَ ٱلنَّاسُ ضُحًۭى
englishTranslationText:
Said	 Moosa,	 “Your	 meeting	 is	 the	 day	 of	
the	 festival,	 and	 that	 the	 people	 be	
assembled	at	late	morning.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Mūsā ne	Kahā, “tumhāra	w’ada	mele	kā	din	
hai	aur	 yeh	 ke	log	 din	 chardhe	jam'a	 kiye	
jāyeñ.”

arabicText: فَتَوَلَّىٰ فِرْعَوْنُ فَجَمَعَ كَيْدَهُۥ ثُمَّ أَتَىٰ
englishTranslationText:
So	 Firaun	 went	 away	 and	 gathered	 his	
schemes,*	then	came.	(* 72000 magicians and their materials.)
romanUrduTranslationText: To	Fir’aun	phira	aur	apne	dāoñ	(makar-ofareb)	ikath-the	kiye	phir	āaya

arabicText: قَالَ لَهُم مُّوسَىٰ وَيْلَكُمْ لَا تَفْتَرُوا۟ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ كَذِبًۭا فَيُسْحِتَكُم بِعَذَابٍۢ ۖ وَقَدْ خَابَ مَنِ ٱفْتَرَىٰ
englishTranslationText:
Moosa	said	to	them,	“Ruin	is	to	you	- do	not	fabricate	a	lie	against	Allah,	that	He	may	destroy	you	
by	a	punishment;	and	indeed	one	who	fabricates	lies	has	failed.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Unse	Mūsā ne	Kahā	tumheñ	kharābi	ho	Allah	par	jhoot	na	bāñdho	ke	woh	tumheñ	'azāb	se	halāk	
kar	de	aur	be-shak		na-murād	rahā	jis	ne	jhoot	bāñdha.

arabicText: فَتَنَـٰزَعُوٓا۟ أَمْرَهُم بَيْنَهُمْ وَأَسَرُّوا۟ ٱلنَّجْوَىٰ
englishTranslationText: So	they	differed	with	one	another	in	their	task,	and	secretly	conferred
romanUrduTranslationText: To	apne	mu'āmle	meiñ	bāham	mukhtalif	ho	gaye	aur	chhup	kar	mashwarat	ki.

arabicText: قَالُوٓا۟ إِنْ هَـٰذَٰنِ لَسَـٰحِرَٰنِ يُرِيدَانِ أَن يُخْرِجَاكُم مِّنْ أَرْضِكُم بِسِحْرِهِمَا وَيَذْهَبَا بِطَرِيقَتِكُمُ ٱلْمُثْلَىٰ
englishTranslationText:
They	said,	“Undoubtedly	these	two	are	magicians	for	sure,	who	wish	to	expel	you	from	your	land	
by	the	strength	of	their	magic,	and	destroy	your	exemplary	religion!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bole	be-shak	yeh	donoñ	zaroor	jādugar	haiñ	chāhte	haiñ	ke	tumheñ	tumhāri	zameen	se	apne	jādu	
ke	zor	se	nikāl	deñ	aur	tumhāra	achchha	deen	le	jāyeñ	.

arabicText: فَأَجْمِعُوا۟ كَيْدَكُمْ ثُمَّ ٱئْتُوا۟ صَفًّۭا ۚ وَقَدْ أَفْلَحَ ٱلْيَوْمَ مَنِ ٱسْتَعْلَىٰ
englishTranslationText:
“Therefore	 strengthen	 your	 scheme,	 and	 come	 forth	in	 rows;	indeed	 whoever	 dominates	 this	
day	has	succeeded.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	apna	dāoñ	(fareb)	pakka	kar	lo	phir	parā	bāndh	(saf	banā)	kar	āao	aur	āaj murād	ko	pahuñcha		
jo	ghālib	raha.

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ يَـٰمُوسَىٰٓ إِمَّآ أَن تُلْقِىَ وَإِمَّآ أَن نَّكُونَ أَوَّلَ مَنْ أَلْقَىٰ
englishTranslationText:
They	said,	“O	Moosa,	either	you	throw	first	
- or	shall	we	throw	first?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bole aey	Mūsā!	Ya	to	tum	dālo	ya	ham	pehle	
dāleñ.

arabicText: قَالَ بَلْ أَلْقُوا۟ ۖ فَإِذَا حِبَالُهُمْ وَعِصِيُّهُمْ يُخَيَّلُ إِلَيْهِ مِن سِحْرِهِمْ أَنَّهَا تَسْعَىٰ
englishTranslationText:
He	 said,	 “Rather,	 you	 may	 throw”;	
thereupon	their	cords	and	their	staves,	by	
the	 strength	 of	 their	 magic,	 appeared	 to	
him	as	if	they	were	(serpents)	moving	fast.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Mūsā ne	Kahā	balke	tum	hi	dālo	jabhi	un	ki	
rassiyañ	aur	lāthiyañ	un	ke	jādu	ke	zor	se	
un	ke	khayāl	meiñ	doudhti	m'aloom	huwiñ.

arabicText: فَأَوْجَسَ فِى نَفْسِهِۦ خِيفَةًۭ مُّوسَىٰ
englishTranslationText: And	Moosa	sensed	fear	in	his	heart.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	apne	jee	meiñ	Mūsā ne	khouf	pāya.

arabicText: قُلْنَا لَا تَخَفْ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ ٱلْأَعْلَىٰ
englishTranslationText:
We	 said,	 “Do	 not	 fear	 - it	 is	 you	 who	 is	
dominant.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ham	 ne	 farmāya	 dar	 nahiñ	 be-shak	 	 tu	 hi	
ghālib	hai.

arabicText: وَأَلْقِ مَا فِى يَمِينِكَ تَلْقَفْ مَا صَنَعُوٓا۟ ۖ إِنَّمَا صَنَعُوا۟ كَيْدُ سَـٰحِرٍۢ ۖ وَلَا يُفْلِحُ ٱلسَّاحِرُ حَيْثُ أَتَىٰ
englishTranslationText:
“And	 cast	 down	 which	 is	 in	 your	 right	
hand	 - it	 will	 devour	 all	 that	 they	 have	
fabricated;	what	 they	have	made	is	only	a	
magician’s	deceit;	and	a	magician	is	never	
successful,	wherever	he	comes.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	dāl	to	de	jo	tere	dahine	hāth	meiñ	hai	
woh	un	ki	banawatoñ	ko	nigal	jāyega	woh	
jo	 bana	 kar	 lāye	 haiñ	 woh	 to	 jādugar	 ka	
fareb	 hai	aur	jādugar	 ka	 bhalā	 nahiñ	 hota	
kahiñ	āawe.

arabicText: فَأُلْقِىَ ٱلسَّحَرَةُ سُجَّدًۭا قَالُوٓا۟ ءَامَنَّا بِرَبِّ هَـٰرُونَ وَمُوسَىٰ
englishTranslationText:
Therefore	all	the	magicians	were	thrown	down	
prostrate	 - they	 said,	 “We	 accept	 faith	 in	 the	
One	Who	is	the	Lord	of	Haroon	and	Moosa.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	 sab	 jādugar	 sajde	 meiñ	 gira	 liye	 gaye	
bola	 ham	 us	 par	Imān lāye	jo	Hāroon aur	
Mūsā ka	Rab hai.

arabicText: قَالَ ءَامَنتُمْ لَهُۥ قَبْلَ أَنْ ءَاذَنَ لَكُمْ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ لَكَبِيرُكُمُ ٱلَّذِى عَلَّمَكُمُ ٱلسِّحْرَ ۖ فَلَأُقَطِّعَنَّ أَيْدِيَكُمْ وَأَرْجُلَكُم مِّنْ خِلَـٰفٍۢ وَلَأُصَلِّبَنَّكُمْ فِى جُذُوعِ ٱلنَّخْلِ وَلَتَعْلَمُنَّ أَيُّنَآ أَشَدُّ عَذَابًۭا وَأَبْقَىٰ
englishTranslationText:
Said	Firaun,	“You	accepted	faith	in	him	before	I	
permitted	 you!	 He	 is	 indeed	 your	 leader	 who	
taught	 you	magic;	 I	 therefore	 swear,	 I	will	 cut	
off	 your	 hands	 and	 your	 legs	 from	 alternate	
sides,	 and	 crucify	 you	 on	 the	 trunks	 of	 palmtrees,	and	you	will	surely	come	to	know	among	
us	 two,	whose	punishment	is	more	severe	and	
more	lasting.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Fir’aun	bola	kya	tum	is	par	Imān lāye	qabl	
iske	 ke	 meiñ	 tumheñ	 ijāzat	 duñ	 be-shak		
woh	 tumhāra	 bada	 hai	 jis	 ne	 tum	 sabko	
jādu	 sikhāya	 to	 mujhe	 qasam	 hai zaroor	
meiñ	 tumhāre	ek	ṭaraf	 ke	hāth	aur	doosri	
ṭaraf	ke	pāuñ	kātuñga	aur	tumheñ	khajoor	
ke	 dund (sookhe tane) par sooli	
chadhāooñga	aur	 zaroor	 tum	jān	jāoge	 ke	
ham	meiñ	kis	ka	'aƶāb	sakht	aur	der	pā	hai.

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ لَن نُّؤْثِرَكَ عَلَىٰ مَا جَآءَنَا مِنَ ٱلْبَيِّنَـٰتِ وَٱلَّذِى فَطَرَنَا ۖ فَٱقْضِ مَآ أَنتَ قَاضٍ ۖ إِنَّمَا تَقْضِى هَـٰذِهِ ٱلْحَيَوٰةَ ٱلدُّنْيَآ
englishTranslationText:
They	 said,	 “We	 shall	 never	 prefer	 you	
above	 the	 clear	 proofs	 that	 have	 come	 to	
us	 from	 the	 One	 Who	 has	 created	 us	 -
therefore	carry	out	what	you	want	to;	only	
in	the	life	of	this	world	will	you	be	able	to!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bole	ham	hargiz	 tujhe	 tarjih	na	deñ	ge	un	
raushan	 daliloñ	 par	 jo	 hamāre	 pās	 āayiñ	
hameñ	apne	paida	karne	wāle	ki	qasam	to	
tu	kar	chuk	jo	tujhe	karna	hai	tu	is	duniya	
hi	ki	zindagi	meiñ	to	karega

arabicText: إِنَّآ ءَامَنَّا بِرَبِّنَا لِيَغْفِرَ لَنَا خَطَـٰيَـٰنَا وَمَآ أَكْرَهْتَنَا عَلَيْهِ مِنَ ٱلسِّحْرِ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ خَيْرٌۭ وَأَبْقَىٰٓ
englishTranslationText:
“Indeed	we	have	accepted	 faith	in	our	Lord,	so	 that	He	may	 forgive	us	our	sins	and	 the	magic	
which	you	forced	us	to	perform;	and	Allah is	Better,	and	the	Most	Lasting.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Be-shak	ham	apne	Rab	par	Imān lāye	ke	woh	hamāri	khatāyeñ	bakhsh	de	aur	woh	jo	tu	ne	hameñ	
majboor	kiya	jādu	par	aur	Allah	behtar	hai	aur	sab	se	ziyada	bāqi	rahne	wāla.

arabicText: إِنَّهُۥ مَن يَأْتِ رَبَّهُۥ مُجْرِمًۭا فَإِنَّ لَهُۥ جَهَنَّمَ لَا يَمُوتُ فِيهَا وَلَا يَحْيَىٰ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	the	one	who	comes	guilty	to	his	Lord	- so	undoubtedly	for	him	is	hell;	neither	dying	nor	
living	in	it.
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Be-shak	jo	apne	Rab ke	huzoor	mujrim	ho	kar	āaye		to	zaroor	us	ke	liye	Jahannam	hai	jis	meiñ	na	
mare	na	jiye.

arabicText: وَمَن يَأْتِهِۦ مُؤْمِنًۭا قَدْ عَمِلَ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ فَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ لَهُمُ ٱلدَّرَجَـٰتُ ٱلْعُلَىٰ
englishTranslationText:
And	 the	 one	who	 presents	 himself	 as	 a	 believer	 before	Him,	 having	 done	 good	 deeds	- so	 for	
them	are	the	high	ranks.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	jo	us	ke	huzoor	Imān ke	sāth	āaye		ke	achchhe	kām	kiye	hoñ	to	unhiñ	ke	darje	ooñche

arabicText: جَنَّـٰتُ عَدْنٍۢ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهَا ٱلْأَنْهَـٰرُ خَـٰلِدِينَ فِيهَا ۚ وَذَٰلِكَ جَزَآءُ مَن تَزَكَّىٰ
englishTranslationText:
Everlasting	Gardens	of	Eden	beneath	which	rivers	flow,	abiding	in	them	for	ever;	and	this	is	the	
reward	of	one	who	became	pure.
romanUrduTranslationText: Basne	ke	bāgh	jis	ke	niche	nahre	baheñ	hamesha	un	meiñ	raheñ	aur	yeh		sila	hai	us	ka	jo	pāk	huwa.

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ أَوْحَيْنَآ إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنْ أَسْرِ بِعِبَادِى فَٱضْرِبْ لَهُمْ طَرِيقًۭا فِى ٱلْبَحْرِ يَبَسًۭا لَّا تَخَـٰفُ دَرَكًۭا وَلَا تَخْشَىٰ
englishTranslationText:
And	 We	 divinely	 inspired	 Moosa	 that,	
“Journey	 with	 My	 bondmen	 in	 a	 part	 of	
the	night	and	strike	a	dry	path	in	the	sea	
for	them,	you	shall	have	no	fear	of	Firaun	
getting	to	you,	nor	any	danger.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 be-shak	 ham	 ne	Mūsā ko	 waḥi	 ki	 ke	
rātoñ	rāt	mere	bandoñ	ko	le	chal	aur	in	ke	
liye	 dariya	 meiñ	 sookha	 rāsta	 nikāl	 de	
tujhe	 dar	 na	hoga	 ke	 fir’aun	āa	le	aur	 na	
khatrah.

arabicText: فَأَتْبَعَهُمْ فِرْعَوْنُ بِجُنُودِهِۦ فَغَشِيَهُم مِّنَ ٱلْيَمِّ مَا غَشِيَهُمْ
englishTranslationText:
So	Firaun	went	after	them	with	his	army	-
therefore	 the	 sea	 enveloped	 them,	 the	
way	it	did.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	 unkke	 peeche	 fir’aun	 pada	 apne	
lashkar	 le	 kar	 to	 unheñ	 dariya	 ne	 dhāñp	
liya	jaisa		dhānp	liya..

arabicText: وَأَضَلَّ فِرْعَوْنُ قَوْمَهُۥ وَمَا هَدَىٰ
englishTranslationText:
And	Firaun	led	his	people	astray,	and	did	
not	guide	them
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	fir’aun	ne	apni	qaum	ko	gumrāh	kiya	
aur	rāh	na	dikhāyi.

arabicText: يَـٰبَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ قَدْ أَنجَيْنَـٰكُم مِّنْ عَدُوِّكُمْ وَوَٰعَدْنَـٰكُمْ جَانِبَ ٱلطُّورِ ٱلْأَيْمَنَ وَنَزَّلْنَا عَلَيْكُمُ ٱلْمَنَّ وَٱلسَّلْوَىٰ
englishTranslationText:
O	 Descendants	 of	 Israel,	 indeed	 We	
rescued	 you	 from	 your	 enemy,	 and	 We	
made	 a	 covenant	 with	 you	 on	 the	 right	
side	of	Mount	Tur,	and	sent	down	Manna	
and	Salwa	upon	you
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	 bani	 Isrāil!	 Be-shak	 ham	 ne	 tumko	
tumhāre	dushman	se	najāt	di	aur	tumheñ	
toor	ki	dāhini	ṭaraf	ka	w’ada	diya	aur	tum	
par	man	aur	salwā	utāra.

arabicText: كُلُوا۟ مِن طَيِّبَـٰتِ مَا رَزَقْنَـٰكُمْ وَلَا تَطْغَوْا۟ فِيهِ فَيَحِلَّ عَلَيْكُمْ غَضَبِى ۖ وَمَن يَحْلِلْ عَلَيْهِ غَضَبِى فَقَدْ هَوَىٰ
englishTranslationText:
“Eat	 the	 good	 clean	 things	 We	 have	
provided	 you,	 and	 do	 not	 exceed	 the	
limits	in	respect	of	it	causing	My	wrath	to	
descend	upon	you;	and	indeed	the	one	on	
whom	My	wrath	descended,	has	fallen.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Khāo	jo	pāk	cheezeñ	ham	ne	tumheñ	rozi	
di	aur	is	meiñ	ziyadti	na	karo	ke	tum	par	
mera	ghazab	utre	aur	jis	par	mera	ghazab	
utra	Be-shak		woh	gira.

arabicText: وَإِنِّى لَغَفَّارٌۭ لِّمَن تَابَ وَءَامَنَ وَعَمِلَ صَـٰلِحًۭا ثُمَّ ٱهْتَدَىٰ
englishTranslationText:
And	 indeed	 I	 am	 Most	 Oft	 Forgiving	 for	
him	who	repented	and	accepted	faith	and	
did	good	deeds,	and	 then	remained	upon	
guidance.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak		maiñ	bahut	bakhsh	ne	wāla	
hoon	usey		jis	ne	tauba	ki	aur	Imān lāya	aur	
achchha	kām	kiya	Phir	hidāyat	par	raha.

arabicText: ۞ وَمَآ أَعْجَلَكَ عَن قَوْمِكَ يَـٰمُوسَىٰ ٨٣
englishTranslationText:
“And	why	did	you	come	in	haste	ahead	of	
your	people,	O	Moosa?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
“Aur	tune	apni	qoum	se	kyuñ	jaldi	ki, aey	
Mūsā?

arabicText: قَالَ هُمْ أُو۟لَآءِ عَلَىٰٓ أَثَرِى وَعَجِلْتُ إِلَيْكَ رَبِّ لِتَرْضَىٰ
englishTranslationText:
He	submitted,	“They	are	here,	just	behind	
me	- and	O	my Lord,	 I	hastened	 towards	
You,	in	order	to	please	You.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Árz	ki	ke	woh	yeh		haiñ	mere	peeche	aur	
aey	mere	Rab! Teri	ṭaraf	maiñ	jaldi	kar	ke	
hāzir	huwa	ke	Tu	rāzi	ho

arabicText: قَالَ فَإِنَّا قَدْ فَتَنَّا قَوْمَكَ مِنۢ بَعْدِكَ وَأَضَلَّهُمُ ٱلسَّامِرِىُّ
englishTranslationText: He	said,	“We	have	therefore	tried	your	people	after	you	came,	and	Samri	has	led	them	astray.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Farmāya	to	hamne	tere	āane	ke	b’ad	teri	qoum	ko	balā	meiñ	dālā	aur	unheñ	sāmri	ne	gumrāh	
kar	diya.

arabicText: فَرَجَعَ مُوسَىٰٓ إِلَىٰ قَوْمِهِۦ غَضْبَـٰنَ أَسِفًۭا ۚ قَالَ يَـٰقَوْمِ أَلَمْ يَعِدْكُمْ رَبُّكُمْ وَعْدًا حَسَنًا ۚ أَفَطَالَ عَلَيْكُمُ ٱلْعَهْدُ أَمْ أَرَدتُّمْ أَن يَحِلَّ عَلَيْكُمْ غَضَبٌۭ مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ فَأَخْلَفْتُم مَّوْعِدِى
englishTranslationText:
So	Moosa	 turned	back	 to	his	people,	angry	and	grieving;	he	said,	 “O	my	people,	had	not	your	
Lord	given	you	a	good	promise?	Did	a	long	time	pass	away	for	you,	or	did	you	wish	that	your	
Lord’s	wrath	come	upon	you,	therefore	you	broke	your	promise	with	me?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	Mūsā apni	Qoum	ki	ṭaraf	palta	ghusse	meiñ	bhara	afsos	karta	Kahā	aey	meri	qaum!	kya	tumse	
tumhāre	Rab ne	achha	w'ada	na	kiya	tha	Kya	tum	par	muddat	lambi	guzri	ya	tumne	chāha	ke	
tum	par	tumhāre	Rab ka	ghazab	utre	to	tum	ne	mera	w'ada	khilāf	kiya.

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ مَآ أَخْلَفْنَا مَوْعِدَكَ بِمَلْكِنَا وَلَـٰكِنَّا حُمِّلْنَآ أَوْزَارًۭا مِّن زِينَةِ ٱلْقَوْمِ فَقَذَفْنَـٰهَا فَكَذَٰلِكَ أَلْقَى ٱلسَّامِرِىُّ
englishTranslationText:
They	said,	 “We	did	not	renege	on	our	promise	 to	 you	on	our	own	will,	but	we	were	made	 to	
carry	the	burdens	of	ornaments	of	the	people,	so	we	cast	them	- and	similarly	did	Samri	cast.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bole	ham	ne	āap	ka	w'ada	apne	ikhtiyār	se	khilāf	na	kiya	lekin	hamse	kuchh	bojh	uthwāye	gaye	
is	qaum	ke	gahne ke	to	ham	ne	unheñ	dāl	diya	phir	isi	ṭarah	sāmri	ne	dāla.

arabicText: فَأَخْرَجَ لَهُمْ عِجْلًۭا جَسَدًۭا لَّهُۥ خُوَارٌۭ فَقَالُوا۟ هَـٰذَآ إِلَـٰهُكُمْ وَإِلَـٰهُ مُوسَىٰ فَنَسِىَ
englishTranslationText:
He	 therefore	 made	 a	 calf	 for	 them	 - a	
lifeless	 body,	 making	 sounds	 like	 a	 cow	-
so	they	said,	“This	is	your	God	and	the	God	
of	Moosa;	whereas	Moosa	has	forgotten.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	us	ne	un	ke	liye	ek	bachhda	nikāla	be-jān	
ka	dhad, gāye	ki	tarah	bolta	- to	bole, “Yeh
hai	 tumhāra	 m'abood	 aur	 Mūsā ka	
m'abood; Mūsā to	bhool		gaye.”

arabicText: أَفَلَا يَرَوْنَ أَلَّا يَرْجِعُ إِلَيْهِمْ قَوْلًۭا وَلَا يَمْلِكُ لَهُمْ ضَرًّۭا وَلَا نَفْعًۭا
englishTranslationText:
So	do	they	not	see	that	it	does	not	answer	
to	any	of	 their	speech?	And	has	no	power	
to	cause	them	any	harm	or	benefit?
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	kya	nahiñ	dekhte	ke	woh	unheñ	kisi	bāt	
ka	 jawāb	 nahiñ	 deta	 aur	 un	 ke	 kisi	 bure	
bhale	ka	ikhtiyār	nahiñ	rakhta.

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ قَالَ لَهُمْ هَـٰرُونُ مِن قَبْلُ يَـٰقَوْمِ إِنَّمَا فُتِنتُم بِهِۦ ۖ وَإِنَّ رَبَّكُمُ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنُ فَٱتَّبِعُونِى وَأَطِيعُوٓا۟ أَمْرِى
englishTranslationText:
And	 undoubtedly	 Haroon	 had	 told	 them	
before	 it	 that,	 “O	 my	 people	 - you	 have	
needlessly	 fallen	into	trial	because	of	this;	
and	indeed	your	Lord	is	the	Most	Gracious,	
therefore	 follow	 me	 and	 obey	 my	
command.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 be-shak	 un	 se	 Hāroon ne	 is	 se	 pahle	
Kahā	tha	ke	aey	meri	qaum!	yooñ	hi	hai	ke	
tum	is	ke	sabab	fitne	meiñ	pade	aur	be-shak	
tumhāra	 Rab Rahmān	 hai	 to	 meri	 pairvi	
karo	aur	mera	hukm	māno	.

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ لَن نَّبْرَحَ عَلَيْهِ عَـٰكِفِينَ حَتَّىٰ يَرْجِعَ إِلَيْنَا مُوسَىٰ
englishTranslationText:
They	 said,	 “We	 will	 continue	 to	 squat	 *	
before	 it,	 till	 Moosa	 returns	 to	 us.”	 (*	
Continue	worshipping	it.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bole	ham	to	is	par	āasan	māre	jame	(pooja	
akele	 jam	 kar	 bethe)	 raheñ	 ge	 jab	 tak	
hamare	pās	Mūsā laut	ke	āayeñ	.

arabicText: قَالَ يَـٰهَـٰرُونُ مَا مَنَعَكَ إِذْ رَأَيْتَهُمْ ضَلُّوٓا۟
englishTranslationText:
They	 said,	 “We	 will	 continue	 to	 squat	 *	
before	 it,	 till	 Moosa	 returns	 to	 us.”	 (*	
Continue	worshipping	it.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Said	 Moosa,	 “O	 Haroon	 - what	 prevented	
you	when	you	saw	them	going	astray?”

arabicText: أَلَّا تَتَّبِعَنِ ۖ أَفَعَصَيْتَ أَمْرِى
englishTranslationText:
“That	 you	 did	 not	 come	 after	 me?	 So	 did	
you	disobey	my	order?”
romanUrduTranslationText: Ke mere peechhe āate to kya tum ne mera ukm na māna.

arabicText: قَالَ يَبْنَؤُمَّ لَا تَأْخُذْ بِلِحْيَتِى وَلَا بِرَأْسِىٓ ۖ إِنِّى خَشِيتُ أَن تَقُولَ فَرَّقْتَ بَيْنَ بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ وَلَمْ تَرْقُبْ قَوْلِى
englishTranslationText:
He	said,	“O	son	of	my	mother,	do	not	clutch	
my	beard	nor	the	hair	on	my	head;	I	feared	
that	 you	 may	 say,	 ‘You	 have	 caused	 a	
division	 among	 the	 Descendants	 of	 Israel	
and	did	not	wait	for	my	advice.’	”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kahā	 aey	 mere	 māñ	 jāye	 na	 meri	 dādhi	
pakdo	 aur	 na	 mere	 sar	 ke	 bāl	 mujhe	 yeh		
dar	huwa	ke	tum	kaho	ge	tum	ne	bani	isrāil	
meiñ	 tafirqa	dāl	diya	aur	 tum	ne	meri	bāt	
ka	intezār	na	kiya.

arabicText: قَالَ فَمَا خَطْبُكَ يَـٰسَـٰمِرِىُّ
englishTranslationText:
Said	 Moosa,	 “And	 what	 is	 your	
explanation,	O	Samri?”
romanUrduTranslationText: Mūsā ne	kahā	ab	tera	kya	hāl	hai, aey	sāmri?
